last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>619469472
>CLASSIC GTA(meaning GTA through GTA 2)
meh, time has taken its toll on them. Requires modding in order to have it run correctly
>GTA III
Good, definitely outdated but still a good time. Requires modding before launch in order to have it run correctly.
>GTA Vice City
Surprisingly fun still to this day. Story is solid, music is great, and missions are fun. Requires modding before launch in order to have it run correctly
>GTA San Andreas
Best in the series. Hold up extremely well, both gameplaywise and story. It's the magnum opus of GTA. It has everything. Modding is required to have it run correctly, but it also has a lot of potential to add even more fun to an already 10/10 game so go ham when modding it.
>GTA Advance
I quit an hour in because the framerate was unbearable.
>Liberty City Stories
Basically a middle child of GTA III and Vice City. It's not bad, but nothing special either. Play the PS2 version if you're planning on playing it. The PSP suffers technical issues such as low framerate.
>Vice City Stories
Basically a middle child of Vice City and San Andreas. It's good, story is a bit weak but the gameplay is fun and the business feature is surprisingly addictive. Same issues as with LCS, play the PS2 version.

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>HD gen:
>GTA IV
A solid GTA mafia drama. PC port is still busted to don't expect high or even stable framerate no matter the system. Doesn't require modding, but greatly enhances it due to it's mid 2000's era grey shit filter every game had.
>TLAD
Not a very good one. Suffers from the same problems as it's host game.
>TBoGT
A solid entry. Basically GTA IV minus the seriousness. It has some grounded content but Rockstar listened to their fans and made GTA IV a game focused on having fun rather than serious.
>Chinatown Wars
Went in with a sceptical mind. Went out with nothing but joy. Solid GTA and an addictive drug dealing system. Played on DS, heard the PSP version is the better option of the three.
>GTA V
Thought the story was kind of stupid. They dumbed down everything that was fun in GTA IV and went back to a serious game with a stupid undertone. Characters speak too much when you play them, map is impressive yet fuckingly empty and collecting things in the size of 8 pixels is not fun and I hate having to google a map in order to find everything. Also the rewards were ALL complete garbage considering all the work to get them. Not the worst, but certainly not the best

*drops mic*

last_replies.name: Anonymous
last_replies.com:
>>619473698
For starters it's one of the least railroaded pokemon experiences ever made. In a good way.
And it's also one of the least hand-holdy pokemon games since the old classic games.

This comes with the freedom to choose where on the level curve you want to adventure in and what challenges to face off against first.
And since they designed the game around three paths, the classic gyms just being one of them. Titan battles and Team Star challenges being the other two. There is also generally more to do at each given stage of the level curve. So even if you jump ahead in the level curve and win, that doesn't mean you've already depleted all the significant content of that level. Giving you a fair bit to do and ample opportunities to try the waters before settling on what level of challenges you actually feel like engaging in.

SV also nailed it really well when it comes to its characters. And the stories for gyms, titans, and team star are all rather good if nothing else surprisingly well put together for Pokemon.
The different paths also give you different rewards for completing them. Giving you different incentives to engage with said paths, and whether or not you run out one to completion or hop between them is entirely up to you and likely depend on what rewards you desire or if a particular plotline resonated with you especially.

It's also kind of cool to just explore the world to find unique pokemon and items.
And it's somewhat neat how the world is set up. Higher level pokemon are generally tougher to get to. Either further away from the south/south-centre where you start. But you'll find higher level pokemon all over the place if you just circle around mountains, climb cliffs, jump down from various heights. Etc. You can get a good hunch of what to expect to find but you can never be sure.
And the new pokemon designs and pokemon distribution are pretty cool too. Or so I think anyway.

I don't know. I certainly think the games are well worth trying.
